Node.definition: = a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority
literally: a ruling or decision; hence: = a law or ordinance handed down by a ruler or a deity that a particular group of people is expected to obey
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= pattern of behavior required from someone by somebody in authority
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: days grow long > long time passes
Node.definition: literally: days grow long; hence: = process in which a considerably amount of time passes
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to be careful|to make sure|to take precautions
Node.definition: = action by which humans ensure their own well being by being watchful, by making sure that certain instructions are carried out, or by refraining from certain activities

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a linker indicating that one proposition is the purpose or result or another
= state in which people live in a condition of well being
= a linker indicating that one proposition is the purpose or result or another
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= indirect male progenitor

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process whereb liquids move freely as in a stream

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
= sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= causative action by which humans attach objects to other objects with a rope
= object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= a small artifact ► to be tied upon the hand, or on the forehead ► as a kind of religious amulet
= the area separating two or mores locations
= the hair growing on the ridge above a person’s eye socket
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed
= upright part of a door frame; a few passages mention square door frames and in such cases the horizontal elements are also referred to as doorposts

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= indirect male progenitor
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an animate or inanimate object is relatively large in size
= state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= objects that are considered of a good quality and attractive to the eye
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= hole in the ground, big enough to hold a person and deep enough that a person cannot climb out; ◄ usually dug out of the ground or hewn from rock; ► often used to collect and store rain water; ≈ fresh water from a spring is considered superior to stagnant water from a cistern

Node.gloss: to hew out|to dig|to cut out|to dress|to mine
Node.definition: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to hew out|to dig|to cut out|to dress|to mine
Node.definition: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

Node.gloss: to be careful|to make sure|to take precautions
Node.definition: = action by which humans ensure their own well being by being watchful, by making sure that certain instructions are carried out, or by refraining from certain activities

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
literally: house (of an object); hence: = a place that is associated with a certain class people that live there, or objects that are found there

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity, perform the required rituals, and live in accordance with the requirements of that deity
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is committed to follow Y's leadership and example
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= attitude by which deities insist on receiving the attention and commitment that is in keeping with one's status
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= process by which the anger (אַף) of humans and deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
literally: to put (a deity) to the test; = action by which humans are disobedient towards deities in spite of the possibility that they might provoke them to anger

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
literally: to put (a deity) to the test; = action by which humans are disobedient towards deities in spite of the possibility that they might provoke them to anger
= location, also called Meribah (מְרִיבָה) ► along the route of the exodus; one of the places where the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) rebelled against Moses (מֹשֶׁה) because of a lack of water
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.

Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which people live in a condition of well being

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= indirect male progenitor
= causative action by which someone causes others to move away from a certain place by force, ◄ as if by physically pushing them away

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

literally: tomorrow; hence: = a reference to a moment in the future

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority

= supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ►in order to assert his power and greatness
= supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ►in order to assert his power and greatness
= state in which an event has a high intensity

= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= king of Egypt
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: it is well (with someone); hence: = state in which people go through a time of relative prosperity
literally: all the days; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption

Node.gloss: to keep alive|to restore to life
Node.definition: = to cause an object to become or remain alive and well; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in most cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.definition: = action by which humans ensure their own well being by being watchful, by making sure that certain instructions are carried out, or by refraining from certain activities
